sec.title: See You in Chicago for the AOSSM 2013 Annual Meeting
sec.p: Advance registration for the Annual Meeting is now closed, but on-site registration will be available. If you are registered, be sure to check your inbox for updates on meeting details and instructional course handouts, if purchased.

sec.title: AJSM has an App
sec.p: Enjoy the latest from AJSM and Sports Health anywhere you are with our new app! Current subscribers can now download the apps for free from the iTunes store. Look for the app for OJSM later in July!

sec.title: AOSSM Research Grant Deadlines Approaching
sec.p: AOSSM, with continued support from Sanofi Biosurgery, will once again offer a research grant to fund investigations related to early osteoarthritis (OA) and/or the prevention of OA following joint injury. The grant will be for $50,000 for either a clinical research study or a lab/basic science project. The deadline for application is August 1, 2013. Visit www.sportsmed.org/Research/Research_Grants for more information and for grant guidelines.

sec.title: Would You Like All Your CME Certificates Located in One Place?
sec.p: The AOSSM and AAOS are collaborating on transferring AOSSM CME credit to one comprehensive CME transcript in the AAOS Learning Portfolio. The AAOS Learning Portfolio helps you track all earned CME credits. With our new process, all of your AOSSM and AAOS CME certificates will be available in your learning portfolio.

To learn more and to review your transcript information, log onto www.sportsmed.org and click on the My CME Transcript link on the left-hand side, then select “transfer my CME Credit.” Contact Pat Kovach at pat@aossm.org with any questions.

sec.title: Help Prevent Sports Injuries in Kids
sec.p: If you haven’t already joined the STOP Sports Injuries campaign or donated, it’s easy to get involved; simply fill out the online form under the Join Our Team tab and submit your sporting organization, hospital/institution, or practice bio and logo. We will then add your information to the site and you will have access to all of the campaign’s materials and a specialized banner to place on your website and utilize in presentations, events, or other materials. Visit the website at www.STOPSportsInjuries.org to join today!

sec.title: Got News We Could Use? Sports Medicine Update Wants to Hear from You!
sec.p: Have you received a prestigious award recently? A new academic appointment? Been named a team physician? AOSSM wants to hear from you! Sports Medicine Update welcomes all members’ news items. Send information to Lisa Weisenberger, AOSSM Director of Communications, at lisa@aossm.org, fax to 847-292-4905, or contact the Society office at 847-292-4900. High-resolution (300 dpi) photos are always welcomed.
